command: bash -lc 'set -euo pipefail; ts=$(date -u +%FT%TZ); d=$(date -u +%F); dest=/opt/ti/closed/contacts/$d; mkdir -p "$dest"; if scp -q -i /etc/ssh/keys/peopledata_ed25519 -o StrictHostKeyChecking=yes -o UserKnownHostsFile=/etc/ssh/known_hosts_peopledata -o IdentitiesOnly=yes client@sftp.peopledata.pro:/feeds/org/contacts/acme_corp/current.json{,.sha256} "$dest"/ && (cd "$dest" && sha256sum -c current.json.sha256); then printf "{\"timestamp\":\"%s\",\"technique\":\"T1597\",\"source\":\"peopledata-pro\",\"artifact\":\"%s/current.json\",\"status\":\"verified\"}\n" "$ts" "$dest" | tee -a /var/log/ti_fetch.json; else printf "{\"timestamp\":\"%s\",\"technique\":\"T1597\",\"source\":\"peopledata-pro\",\"status\":\"error\"}\n" "$ts" >&2; fi'
explanation: Pulls a closed-source organizational contacts dataset (JSON) via SFTP, suitable for profiling and relationship mapping under T1597.
rationale_steps: Establish secure SFTP session with key-only auth and host key validation.
Fetch the latest org contacts JSON and its checksum.
Use sha256sum to ensure integrity before use.
Emit a JSON status record and store the dataset under controlled paths.
